metadata.title: CVE-2016-7438 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The C software implementation of ECC in wolfSSL (formerly CyaSSL) before3.9.10 makes it easier for local users to discover RSA keys by leveragingcache-bank hit differences.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7438` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwolfssl10 - 3.9.10+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wolfssl package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.9.10+dfsg-1').
